messages.title: We’ll make sure Scotland’s NHS is always cared for.
messages.content: In this election the more seats the SNP wins the more power and influence Scotland will have at Westminster. We fully intend to make that count for the NHS. Nicola Sturgeon is backing plans to invest an extra £9.5 billion in the health service across the UK. For Scotland that would mean an extra £2 billion for the health budget by 2020. The better funded our NHS, the healthier our country will be. Make it happen. On May 7th, vote SNP to make Scotland stronger at Westminster.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The SNP is committed to increasing the budget for NHS Scotland. Plans include an investment of an extra £2 billion by 2020 as a result of an overall £9.5 billion increase in health service funding across the UK.

issues.health: The SNP pledges more power and influence for Scotland at Westminster to ensure that the NHS is properly funded, with an increase of £2 billion for Scotland's health budget by 2020 stemming from an overall £9.5 billion increase in UK health service funding.

images.caption: WHO WILL DEMAND EXTRA CASH FOR SCOTLAND’S NHS?
